intro: Lappula saissanica, commonly known as the Saisan lappula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and open fields. Its leaves are usually succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in dry conditions. Lappula saissanica is often found in regions of southern Europe and western Asia.
